text: - I'm Lucas Biewald,

I'm the CEO and Co-founder
of Weights and Biases.

Weights and Biases is, at
its core, a gen AI company
since the very beginning.
We helped OpenAI build

and launch GPT 1, 2, 3, 4,
and hopefully many more.

We also helped Meta
Launch Llama 2, Mistral,
and so many other foundation models
that, you know, you might be using.

The biggest disconnect we
see among people trying

to deploy gen AI into
production is how close they are
to actually deployed and finished.

I think one of the big
problems with gen AI, maybe one

of the opportunities too,
is that it's very easy
to make a compelling demo
and the lay person looks at that demo

and they say, "Wow, this
is an amazing application."
It's almost into production,

but actually at that point,
the work has just started.
I think security and model safety

and fast delivery really
depends on the application.

So there's fun applications
generating images,

and I think there, you
might need less security.

Still some, but it might not
be as absolutely crucial.

Then there's mission-critical
applications,
where you just can't get it wrong,

and you have to devote
enormous amount of resources
to make sure that your model's safe,
and in some cases, you might not want
to even be using gen AI at this point.
It's really important to us

that our customers can use
our product without doing too

much integration, and we
basically have a one line

integration with SageMaker
and customers love it.
We're always working to make it better,

but we're especially excited
to now work with Bedrock,
where we see a lot

of the forward looking
companies actually using new
gen AI models, and we'd love
to have a great integration there as well.

AWS helps my software
company be more successful
serving our customers.
(light music)
